title: Quiz 7: Infertility Management
description: Assess your understanding of infertility causes, investigations, and treatment options.

questions.question: Infertility is defined as the inability to achieve a pregnancy after ___BLANK___ year(s) of unprotected intercourse.
questions.explanation: The standard medical definition is 1 year of regular unprotected intercourse.

questions.question: Semen analysis should normally be the first step in an infertility investigation.
questions.explanation: It is non-invasive and rules out male factors (40-50% of causes) early. If no sperm, female investigation may be pointless.
questions.hint: Is it easier to test the man or the woman?

questions.question: Which of the following are common causes of Male Infertility? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Undescended testes, mumps, and varicocele affect sperm production. Endometriosis is a female condition.

questions.question: Match the term with its definition:

pairs.right: Previous conception occurred, but now unable

questions.question: What is the purpose of Hysterosalpingography (HSG) in infertility investigation?
questions.explanation: HSG uses dye and x-rays to see if the fallopian tubes are open (patent).

questions.question: What is the recommended temperature for scrotal contents relative to body temperature for optimal spermatogenesis?
questions.explanation: Testes need to be about 1 degree Centigrade lower than body temperature.

questions.question: Which methods can confirm ovulation in the female? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Temp, mucus, and progesterone levels confirm ovulation. HSG checks anatomy/tubes.
questions.hint: Select physiological signs of egg release.

questions.question: Which drug is prescribed to men to improve spermatogenesis?
questions.explanation: Synthetic androgens like Mesterolone (Proviron) are used to stimulate spermatogenesis.

questions.question: Arrange the steps for semen analysis specimen collection:
questions.explanation: Abstinence ensures count accuracy. Freshness is vital for motility check.

questions.question: Which condition in women causes the cervix to be hostile to sperm, potentially killing them?
questions.explanation: Sperm antibodies or infection can make cervical mucus hostile, immobilizing or killing sperm.
